org.bubblecloud.zigbee.network.packet.simple

Class ZB_SEND_DATA_REQUEST

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.bubblecloud.zigbee.network.packet.ZToolPacket
      • org.bubblecloud.zigbee.network.packet.simple.ZB_SEND_DATA_REQUEST

  • public class ZB_SEND_DATA_REQUEST
extends ZToolPacket
    This command initiates transmission of data to another device in the network. This command can only be issued after the application processor has registered its application using the ZB_APP_REGISTER_REQUEST and the device has successfully created or joined a network.
    Version:
    $LastChangedRevision: 799 $ ($LastChangedDate: 2013-08-06 19:00:05 +0300 (Tue, 06 Aug 2013) $)
    Author:
    Alvaro Fides Valero

    • Constructor Detail

      • ZB_SEND_DATA_REQUEST

        public ZB_SEND_DATA_REQUEST()

      • ZB_SEND_DATA_REQUEST

        public ZB_SEND_DATA_REQUEST(ZToolAddress16 destination,
                    DoubleByte commandId,
                    int handle,
                    int txoptions_type1,
                    int radius,
                    int payloadLen,
                    int[] buffer1)
        Create the ZB_SEND_DATA_REQUEST packet.

        Address can be one of the following -:

        • 0 - 0xFFF7: 16-bit short address of the destination device
        • 0xFFFC: Group of all routers and coordinator
        • 0xFFFD: Group of all devices with receiver turned on
        • 0xFFFE: This is the binding address and should be used when a binding entry has been previously created for this particular CommandId. The destination address will be determined from the binding table by the CC2530-ZNP
        • 0xFFFF: Broadcast group of all devices in the network
        Parameters:
        destination - The destination address of the data packet.
        commandId - The command ID to send with the message.
        handle - A handle used to identify the send data request. The corresponding ZB_SEND_DATA_CONFIRM will have the same handle value. This can be useful if the application wishes to match up ZB_SEND_DATA_REQUESTs with ZB_SEND_DATA_CONFIRMs
        txoptions_type1 -
        radius - The max number of hops the packet can travel through before it is dropped.
        payloadLen - Specifies the size of the Data buffer in bytes.
        buffer1 - Data. Without any security (99 bytes), with NWK security (81 bytes), with NWK and APS security (64 bytes).
